snippet: Beijing’s cabinet will try to cut emissions from coal-fired power plants by 60 percent by 2020, the state news agency Xinhua said.
abstract: Officials in China, world's largest coal consumer and polluter, say they will upgrade country's coal plants in effort to reduce carbon emissions; Pres Xi Jinping reasserts, during his appearance at Paris climate talks, China's willingness to assist international campaign against global warming.
lead_paragraph: Beijing’s cabinet will try to cut emissions from coal-fired power plants by 60 percent by 2020, the state news agency Xinhua said.

headline.main: China Plans to Upgrade Coal Plants
headline.print_headline: China Plans to Upgrade Coal Plants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
